commit_message:
Add module apply usage guide

This guide can be useful for those who need to apply software
modules to their databases like updates, external packages,
or probably the most common case, licensing.

This guide would have not been possible without the help of
Peter, he wrote this guide for me when I asked for help in
a review. I've been sitting on it for some time and made
all the necessary formatting changes, minor edits, as well as
reperformed all the steps so the output is accurate.

Note: I was admin when making this guide so there are fields
that aren't normally visible to the user.

Change-Id: I784b344adb29382287052c1aedaf7f96656adb8b
Co-Authored-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>
Co-Authored-By: chenxing <chen.xing@99cloud.net>
Closes-Bug: #1669050

Change-Id: I33a1172a3e65a5f6a607c97bcd074d7221d5e9b4
Closes-Bug: #1686104

commit_message:
Change all to baremetal on baremetal role

Pointing to all in the groups iteration causes deployment fail
when deployer node(localhost) does not have api_interface.

OpenStack nodes need api_interface by deployer not need api_interface
always that have connection by any interface to all nodes.

Change-Id: I33a1172a3e65a5f6a607c97bcd074d7221d5e9b4
Closes-Bug: #1686104

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-07 10:17:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/drivers/linux/iptables_fwaas_v2.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/drivers/linux/iptables_fwaas.py'], 'message': 'Modify an order between iptables and conntrack when update firewall

When update a firewall, we should update the iptables firstly,
and then remove the conntrack record, just like the function
create_firewall() and create_firewall_group(). Otherwise, the
contrack record could be reproduced. It will be occurred more
easily in scenario of large flow, because removing conntrack
and updating firewall will take some time, and in this interval
the subsequent flow could be came to reproduced the same
conntrack record.

Change-Id: I7bd36964199c6ce7c146f3ef06a693e9c6fe5353
Closes-bug: #1696093
'}]
commit_message:
Modify an order between iptables and conntrack when update firewall

When update a firewall, we should update the iptables firstly,
and then remove the conntrack record, just like the function
create_firewall() and create_firewall_group(). Otherwise, the
contrack record could be reproduced. It will be occurred more
easily in scenario of large flow, because removing conntrack
and updating firewall will take some time, and in this interval
the subsequent flow could be came to reproduced the same
conntrack record.

Change-Id: I7bd36964199c6ce7c146f3ef06a693e9c6fe5353
Closes-bug: #1696093

subject: WIP: Straw man for new format for vendor data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-11 16:30:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/vendor-profile.rst'], 'message': "WIP: Straw man for new format for vendor data

Based on learning so far, introduce a new clearer version of the vendor
profile doc.

The goal would be that a vendor would publish this document in a
canonical public location. We'll also make a tool that would make it
easy for a vendor to have a template with just the choices they've made
and the tool would crawl the discovery urls for them. Also, a tool
that would do best-effort for a user to create a vendor profile doc if
their vendor does not have one.

This introduces a version to the document. We'll update occ to add a
version to the current ones but default to 1.0 if no version is given.
There is no intent to drop suport for 1.0, but the reading of 1.0 should
internally become translation into the new form.

This includes copies of all of the version discovery docs. The reason
for that is that those typically change very infrequently and take quite
a few API calls to collect- especially given that they are not linked to
directly. A release valve is there for clouds that _do_ expect
those documents to change more frequently than updating their profile
document would allow, or for clouds wanting to do staged-rollouts of
services and thus want users to hit the keystone catalog every time.

This is in yaml form for ease of reading, but like the current vendor
data I expect we'll land it in json format for ease of consumption by
all tools.

Change-Id: Ic1b5f16dcc38d80aec17ccf8d78482532a3695ea
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Straw man for new format for vendor data

Based on learning so far, introduce a new clearer version of the vendor
profile doc.

The goal would be that a vendor would publish this document in a
canonical public location. We'll also make a tool that would make it
easy for a vendor to have a template with just the choices they've made
and the tool would crawl the discovery urls for them. Also, a tool
that would do best-effort for a user to create a vendor profile doc if
their vendor does not have one.

This introduces a version to the document. We'll update occ to add a
version to the current ones but default to 1.0 if no version is given.
There is no intent to drop suport for 1.0, but the reading of 1.0 should
internally become translation into the new form.

This includes copies of all of the version discovery docs. The reason
for that is that those typically change very infrequently and take quite
a few API calls to collect- especially given that they are not linked to
directly. A release valve is there for clouds that _do_ expect
those documents to change more frequently than updating their profile
document would allow, or for clouds wanting to do staged-rollouts of
services and thus want users to hit the keystone catalog every time.

This is in yaml form for ease of reading, but like the current vendor
data I expect we'll land it in json format for ease of consumption by
all tools.

Change-Id: Ic1b5f16dcc38d80aec17ccf8d78482532a3695ea

subject: Fix raising an error on rebalance warnings
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-30 12:39:14.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/rebalance-exit-codes-ee79621190315a5a.yaml', 'manifests/ringbuilder/rebalance.pp'], 'message': "Fix raising an error on rebalance warnings

If the ring has been rebalanced recently, the next call to rebalance
will not rebalance again if the time passed is shorter than
min_part_time. swift-ring-builder returns an exit code of 1 in this
case, which is a warning, but not a hard error (errors will use an exit
code of 2).

It makes sense therefore to expect an exit code of 0 or 1 and only fail
if it's different.

Closes-Bug: 1677588
Change-Id: I03dd075c590344a920099c57b6a7530f103e0ede
"}]
commit_message:
Fix raising an error on rebalance warnings

If the ring has been rebalanced recently, the next call to rebalance
will not rebalance again if the time passed is shorter than
min_part_time. swift-ring-builder returns an exit code of 1 in this
case, which is a warning, but not a hard error (errors will use an exit
code of 2).

It makes sense therefore to expect an exit code of 0 or 1 and only fail
if it's different.

Closes-Bug: 1677588

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I9b23a0dfadaa195bc22ee7f8b8da0c0c9a0e6052
Closes-Bug:#1693670

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-15 03:24:24.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/drivers/swift.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_swift.py'], 'message': 'Fix swift auth_url/url check

"backup_swift_url" and "backup_swift_auth_url" config options
are used for different modes. The first one is used when
backup_swift_auth=per_user, and the second one is used when
backup_swift_auth=single_user.

So they should not be checked in both modes. We should separate
them to avoid some unexpected error.

Change-Id: I278f07f4df553db1063d79bc5575ed1b30e503b1
Closes-bug: #1690281
'}]
commit_message:
Fix swift auth_url/url check

"backup_swift_url" and "backup_swift_auth_url" config options
are used for different modes. The first one is used when
backup_swift_auth=per_user, and the second one is used when
backup_swift_auth=single_user.

So they should not be checked in both modes. We should separate
them to avoid some unexpected error.

Change-Id: I278f07f4df553db1063d79bc5575ed1b30e503b1
Closes-bug: #1690281

subject: Add polkit rule to allow kolla nova user access to libvirtd socket on docker host
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-06 20:49:20.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_docker_spec.rb', 'manifests/profile/base/docker.pp'], 'message': "Add polkit rule to allow kolla nova user access to libvirtd socket on docker host

The polkit rules are currently evaluated in the context of the docker host.
As a result the check fails for the kolla nova compute user, as the uids are not
consistent with the host uids (in fact we probably can't assume a nova user exists
on the docker host).

As a short-term workaround a 'docker_nova' user group is created on the docker host
and the polkit rule is updated to grant this user access to the libvirtd socket.

Longer term solution probably requires running polkitd in a container too.

Change-Id: I91be1f1eacf8eed9017bbfef393ee2d66771e8d6
Related-bug: #1693844
"}]
commit_message:
Add polkit rule to allow kolla nova user access to libvirtd socket on docker host

The polkit rules are currently evaluated in the context of the docker host.
As a result the check fails for the kolla nova compute user, as the uids are not
consistent with the host uids (in fact we probably can't assume a nova user exists
on the docker host).

As a short-term workaround a 'docker_nova' user group is created on the docker host
and the polkit rule is updated to grant this user access to the libvirtd socket.

Longer term solution probably requires running polkitd in a container too.

Change-Id: I91be1f1eacf8eed9017bbfef393ee2d66771e8d6
Related-bug: #1693844

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq driver with blocking executor

We recently move ack/requeue of messages in main/polling thread
of rabbitmq drivers. And break the blocking executor.

This one is not tested by any tests and now deprecated.

This change workaround the issue until we completely remove the
blocking executor.

Change-Id: I445ca6ec7c79d9ab59610c94aa675d3da0daa37f
Closes-bug: #1694728

subject: Brocade ICX driver: remove port from vlan prior to add
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-07 14:38:53.000000000', 'files': ['networking_generic_switch/tests/unit/netmiko/test_brocade_fastiron.py', 'networking_generic_switch/devices/netmiko_devices/brocade.py', 'networking_generic_switch/devices/netmiko_devices/__init__.py'], 'message': "Brocade ICX driver: remove port from vlan prior to add

Brocade ICX (FastIron) require to remove port from vlan prior to
adding it to other vlan. Random failures may leave port in some
vlan, and normal workflow wouldn't be able to fix this
(On most network switches it will, but not on ICX).

See detailed explanation in bugreport.

I added `return output` to send_commands_to_device() function.
It should be completely safe as previous implementation has no
return at all and newly returned value will be ignored everywhere
in existing the code.

Change-Id: Id1513fc82d31a31b7d4a43fc305c678d17fd42b0
Closes-Bug: 1696409
"}]
commit_message:
Brocade ICX driver: remove port from vlan prior to add

Brocade ICX (FastIron) require to remove port from vlan prior to
adding it to other vlan. Random failures may leave port in some
vlan, and normal workflow wouldn't be able to fix this
(On most network switches it will, but not on ICX).

See detailed explanation in bugreport.

I added `return output` to send_commands_to_device() function.
It should be completely safe as previous implementation has no
return at all and newly returned value will be ignored everywhere
in existing the code.

Change-Id: Id1513fc82d31a31b7d4a43fc305c678d17fd42b0
Closes-Bug: 1696409

subject: Fix inventory without existing stack
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-06 15:53:08.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_validations/tests/test_inventory.py', 'tripleo_validations/inventory.py'], 'message': 'Fix inventory without existing stack

The inventory currently tries to fetch stack outputs without checking if
the stack exists, so the inventory breaks if the plan has no
corresponding stack.

This patch changes the StackOutputs class to hide heat API exceptions
and return an empty output list instead.

Change-Id: Icb9e6828aeb1f65d8707333fc1098942f1691204
Closes-Bug: #1694712
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inventory without existing stack

The inventory currently tries to fetch stack outputs without checking if
the stack exists, so the inventory breaks if the plan has no
corresponding stack.

This patch changes the StackOutputs class to hide heat API exceptions
and return an empty output list instead.

Change-Id: Icb9e6828aeb1f65d8707333fc1098942f1691204
Closes-Bug: #1694712

commit_message:
[doc] Fix incorrect formatting on get alarm count

The spec for Get Alarm Count was appearing literally as:

  ##Get Alarm Counts Get the number of alarms that match the criteria.

  ###GET /v2.0/alarms/count
  etc.

It is now formatted so that the headings are rendered like corresponding entries.

Change-Id: Ic8ddc1fc3f56c00f22e8c0132a49be2cc7cd2fc1

commit_message:
Deprecate property 'metadata' of OS::Heat::DeployedServer

The property 'metadata' doesn't make sense for resource
OS::Heat::DeployedServer, because the deployed server can
be provisioned out of nova. The deployment metadata
we can set by resource.metadata, so deprecate the
property 'metadata' and ignore it.

Change-Id: Id218d699a0d49f127243ec537f719dd247197279
Closes-Bug: #1693661

Previously RequiredServiceMissingException was raised for
all cases of invalid count for Spark master, even if the
service was present but count was otherwise incorrect. Now
the correct exception will be raised depending on whether
master is missing or master has wrong count.

Also, add missing unit tests for validation.

Change-Id: Ide7cc8414086e377c86306630920a3c753811458
'}]
commit_message:
Raise better exception for Spark master validation

Previously RequiredServiceMissingException was raised for
all cases of invalid count for Spark master, even if the
service was present but count was otherwise incorrect. Now
the correct exception will be raised depending on whether
master is missing or master has wrong count.

Also, add missing unit tests for validation.

Change-Id: Ide7cc8414086e377c86306630920a3c753811458

Oslo.config deprecated parameter enforce_type and change its default

usage of it to avoid DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type'

Change-Id: I10d550c5346e0935ee1ae3981d6ba41167577e20

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

Oslo.config deprecated parameter enforce_type and change its default
value to True in Ifa552de0a994e40388cbc9f7dbaa55700ca276b0. Remove the
usage of it to avoid DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type'
argument is deprecated in version '4.0' and will be removed in version
'5.0': The argument enforce_type has changed its default value to True
and then will be removed completely."

Change-Id: I10d550c5346e0935ee1ae3981d6ba41167577e20

commit_message:
Remove **kwargs passing in payload __init__

The **kwargs was used in the payload class ctor to pass the payload
fields initialization up to the ovo base class. This is unnecessary
and confusing.

This patch replaces the **kwargs passing with direct field initialization
to make the payload construction more explicit.

Change-Id: I7770f6550fa40c1d9b0417efa57f58fa9c998d45
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-pike
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change to share access list API

When we do manila access-list, the 'created_at' and 'updated_at' time
should be shown to the user. And then the user could determine which
is the recent access rule. As designed, the recent access-allow
rule caused the error access-status of share instance.
The API change [1] has been merged.

[1] Iad6070d60ec77b7de9cc9679cfa7478876084da1

Change-Id: I4b10faa18a5e4d7394083cd36851fd0260df86a2
Closes-Bug: #1682795

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-07 21:05:12.000000000', 'files': ['placement-api-ref/source/conf.py', 'api-ref/source/conf.py', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 3 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]
3. It makes the code look much better.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: Ia3e792c512da46c2b92d3ad9ec1657849d379052
'}]
commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 3 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]
3. It makes the code look much better.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: Ia3e792c512da46c2b92d3ad9ec1657849d379052

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-06-08 08:55:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavor_swap.py'], 'message': "Remove useless API tests

The 'test_flavor_swap' tests are validating behavior that's already
validated by the larger 'test_flavors' tests and a plethora of
functional tests. This is legacy from the time where exposing 'swap' was
required the 'os-flavor-swap' extension [1]. This extension was not
ported to v2.1 [2] and 'swap' is now part of the default response.

Stop special casing these particular fields.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/81dd5b78
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/a31d917a

Change-Id: I55a57b76a92677fbe7db9b6ef91f8cd4daf30d87
"}]
commit_message:
Remove useless API tests

The 'test_flavor_swap' tests are validating behavior that's already
validated by the larger 'test_flavors' tests and a plethora of
functional tests. This is legacy from the time where exposing 'swap' was
required the 'os-flavor-swap' extension [1]. This extension was not
ported to v2.1 [2] and 'swap' is now part of the default response.

Stop special casing these particular fields.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/81dd5b78
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/a31d917a

Change-Id: I55a57b76a92677fbe7db9b6ef91f8cd4daf30d87

the Hyper-V driver.

This fixes a VM port binding issue in case of failovers.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-06-07 16:00:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_models.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_migrations/migrate_repo/versions/044_placement_add_projects_users.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/api/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "placement: use separate tables for projects/users

We were a bit naughty in Iecbe0eb5717afb0b13ca90d4868a3ca5f9e8902b in
that we didn't normalize the storage of Keystone project and user
identifiers in the API DB's new consumers table. This means that we
will use a whole lot more storage for what ends up being very
repetitive data.

This patch changes the consumers DB table schema's project_id and
user_id columns from VARCHAR(255) to INT data type. This should result
in significantly faster queries for usage information since 9X the
index records can fit into a single index block in memory (36-byte
UUIDs stored in VARCHAR(255) versus 4-byte integers. The more index
records we can fit into a single page of memory, the faster both scans
and seeks will be.

Let's address this now before anything uses the consumers table.

Change-Id: I1b7357739f2a7e55c55d3acb9bd604731c4a2b32
blueprint: placement-project-user
"}]
commit_message:
placement: use separate tables for projects/users

We were a bit naughty in Iecbe0eb5717afb0b13ca90d4868a3ca5f9e8902b in
that we didn't normalize the storage of Keystone project and user
identifiers in the API DB's new consumers table. This means that we
will use a whole lot more storage for what ends up being very
repetitive data.

This patch changes the consumers DB table schema's project_id and
user_id columns from VARCHAR(255) to INT data type. This should result
in significantly faster queries for usage information since 9X the
index records can fit into a single index block in memory (36-byte
UUIDs stored in VARCHAR(255) versus 4-byte integers. The more index
records we can fit into a single page of memory, the faster both scans
and seeks will be.

Let's address this now before anything uses the consumers table.

Change-Id: I1b7357739f2a7e55c55d3acb9bd604731c4a2b32
blueprint: placement-project-user

commit_message:
add using cache to metadata

if  configured adds the resulting metadata tree to the cache and
upon next request retrieves the data from the cache
reduces the time of the second and subsequent sequential requests
to the metadata approximately from 2.5 seconds to 0.1

Change-Id: Ia1408f6ef407eb97db1789b5b60d6b36b162ba4d

commit_message:
[Share Groups] Squash SGS member and SS instances DB tables

Because the former was implemented just because the latter
was absent yet at that moment. Main reason is that they serve
same goals and should be consistent to each other. And it is
much easier to support one single table instead of two separate
tables syncing them each time we update one of them.

Change-Id: I81ba26437554d02a79e4b536d781617f46ce2f07
Partially-Implements bp manila-share-groups

subject: Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-08 09:30:35.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/start_osds.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.

Currently TCMalloc's default tc size is 32MB.
This causes poor performance in ceph storage.
A new ceph_tcmalloc_tc_bytes option has been added
with a default of 128MB.

Closes-Bug: #1693692

Change-Id: Iee93ccdcc4ad0b1a41e6550c125f9474e0c8270f
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.

Currently TCMalloc's default tc size is 32MB.
This causes poor performance in ceph storage.
A new ceph_tcmalloc_tc_bytes option has been added
with a default of 128MB.

Closes-Bug: #1693692

Change-Id: Iee93ccdcc4ad0b1a41e6550c125f9474e0c8270f
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>

commit_message:
Enable some off-by-default checks

Some of the available checks are disabled by default, like:
[H106] Don’t put vim configuration in source files
[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

This patch is to enable the H106 and H203 checks in Zun project.

Change-Id: Ib15bf2af5daebb5cd4d36f36226d92874198296b

subject: [TEST] Remove unnecessary meta-deps
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-07 11:44:59.000000000', 'files': ['meta/main.yml'], 'message': "[TEST] Remove unnecessary meta-deps

The galera_client role implements the use of the
apt_package_pinning role in order to pin the
packages from MariaDB, but it already has the
apt_package_pinning role as a meta-dep for itself
so we don't need to carry it here.

The pip_install role is also a meta-dep for the
galera_client role, so there's no need to carry
it here.

With the galera_client role as a meta dependency,
it runs every time this role is executed, even
when using include_role with a subset of tasks.
We could instead run the galera_client role in
the playbook when the host is initially prepped.

Depends-On: I2661176611806b0b7abfc20bf2eb4828108b9eb2
Change-Id: Ie54edb54b94e8dd1afa50667e1206b1289f4c960
"}]
commit_message:
[TEST] Remove unnecessary meta-deps

The galera_client role implements the use of the
apt_package_pinning role in order to pin the
packages from MariaDB, but it already has the
apt_package_pinning role as a meta-dep for itself
so we don't need to carry it here.

The pip_install role is also a meta-dep for the
galera_client role, so there's no need to carry
it here.

With the galera_client role as a meta dependency,
it runs every time this role is executed, even
when using include_role with a subset of tasks.
We could instead run the galera_client role in
the playbook when the host is initially prepped.

Depends-On: I2661176611806b0b7abfc20bf2eb4828108b9eb2
Change-Id: Ie54edb54b94e8dd1afa50667e1206b1289f4c960

commit_message:
api-ref: Add tags to server(s) detail response

Server tags were added in 2.26 to the server (singular) details
response [1], and servers (plural) detail response[2]. They do not
appear in the api-ref. This patches adds them.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/268932/32/doc/api_samples/os-server-tags/v2.26/server-tags-show-details-resp.json
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/268932/32/doc/api_samples/os-server-tags/v2.26/servers-tags-details-resp.json

Closes-bug: 1673628
Change-Id: Ib6aebb8d336b121888649a1cbfa1b8ac5e0e6e74

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-29 12:34:37.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/feature-configuration.rst'], 'message': "Transpose the featureset documentation table

The featureset table is growing too large as we add new featuresets, and
it's hard to solve conflicts.

By using featuresets on lines rather than columns, we can expand the
table more naturally, and the resolving conflicts will be much easier
since we can manipulate whole lines, and source code diffs work in a
line-based fashion.

Change-Id: I637da5d26a1242c194910d6b2938d731e264134b
"}]
commit_message:
Transpose the featureset documentation table

The featureset table is growing too large as we add new featuresets, and
it's hard to solve conflicts.

By using featuresets on lines rather than columns, we can expand the
table more naturally, and the resolving conflicts will be much easier
since we can manipulate whole lines, and source code diffs work in a
line-based fashion.

Change-Id: I637da5d26a1242c194910d6b2938d731e264134b

commit_message:
Update code to React Router v4 API

* Move from route config to Route components in container components
* Reorganize Authentication functionality to use <Redirect> components
* Move Zaqar connection init from login actions to
  AuthenticatedContent component so history object can be passed to
  ZaqarActions
* Update Deployment Plan, Plans, Roles and Deployment Configuration
  routes
* Add checkRunningDeployment HOC to handle redirecting when Plan
  deployment is in progress

Change-Id: Iaa87a710e3ed57f7bbf41d948583fc5c0b777cec

subject: Optimise the distro package installation
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-05 12:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_install.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'Optimise the distro package installation

In order to optimise the distro package installation
process the list of packages to install is prepared
for the host, then installed by passing the package
task the full list instead of using a loop.

Change-Id: I8bae6b5a39f78a2ee4fb02e31d91c1dd3eca7cb0
'}]
commit_message:
Optimise the distro package installation

In order to optimise the distro package installation
process the list of packages to install is prepared
for the host, then installed by passing the package
task the full list instead of using a loop.

Change-Id: I8bae6b5a39f78a2ee4fb02e31d91c1dd3eca7cb0

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-06-04 09:33:06.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/repo-build.yml'], 'message': 'Simplify multi arch repo build

When using repo_build, we were creating groups by architecture,
but then did complex operations to see if they were using
different os versions.

This commit simplifies this, by creating groups depending on both
arch and distribution: It improves readability, but also
fixes the issues where no group was previously created for
multiple architectures.

Change-Id: I36c3033b8a932a81d98bd85d6cfb738e77147192
Closes-Bug: #1694265
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify multi arch repo build

When using repo_build, we were creating groups by architecture,
but then did complex operations to see if they were using
different os versions.

This commit simplifies this, by creating groups depending on both
arch and distribution: It improves readability, but also
fixes the issues where no group was previously created for
multiple architectures.

Change-Id: I36c3033b8a932a81d98bd85d6cfb738e77147192
Closes-Bug: #1694265

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-06-06 17:50:08.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/compute-role.yaml', 'docker/docker-steps.j2', 'puppet/cephstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/objectstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/role.role.j2.yaml', 'docker/deploy-steps-playbook.yaml', 'puppet/blockstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/controller-role.yaml'], 'message': "Convert puppet and docker steps to ansible

Replace the multiple SoftwareDeployment resources with a common
playbook that runs on all roles, consuming the configuration data
written via the HostPrepAnsible tasks.

This hopefully simplifies things, and will enable re-running the
deploy steps for minor updates (we'll need some way to detect

Change-Id: I674a4d9d2c77d1f6fbdb0996f6c9321848e32662
"}]
commit_message:
Convert puppet and docker steps to ansible

Replace the multiple SoftwareDeployment resources with a common
playbook that runs on all roles, consuming the configuration data
written via the HostPrepAnsible tasks.

This hopefully simplifies things, and will enable re-running the
deploy steps for minor updates (we'll need some way to detect
a container should be replaced, but that will be done via a
follow-up patch).

Change-Id: I674a4d9d2c77d1f6fbdb0996f6c9321848e32662

commit_message:
Use get_rpc_transport instead of get_transport

With the added get_rpc_transport() function in oslo.messaging [1]
and the recent version bump of oslo.messaging to 5.24.2, we can
safely replace get_transport() with get_rpc_transport() which is much
cleaner.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454194/

Change-Id: Ib7e204a40e88aecfbd9b024feefdc7aa45e943e2

subject: Add makestep in chrony.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-06 08:28:38.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/chrony/templates/chrony.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Add makestep in chrony.conf

Normally chronyd will cause the system to gradually correct any time offset, by slowing down or speeding up the clock as required.
In certain situations, the system clock might be so far adrift
that this slewing process would take a very long time to correct the system clock

Change-Id: I939b6aae1dbeb133203085ec68bdb9f7936ee9ef
Closes-Bug: #1696056
'}]
commit_message:
Add makestep in chrony.conf

Normally chronyd will cause the system to gradually correct any time offset, by slowing down or speeding up the clock as required.
In certain situations, the system clock might be so far adrift
that this slewing process would take a very long time to correct the system clock

Change-Id: I939b6aae1dbeb133203085ec68bdb9f7936ee9ef
Closes-Bug: #1696056

commit_message:
Add congress-dashboard to $PROJECTS variable in murano-congress-job

Now murano-cpngress-job gives the error:
The /opt/stack/new/congress-dashboard project was not found;
if this is a gate job, add the project to the $PROJECTS variable
in the job definition.

So we need add congress-dashboard to $PROJECTS variable.

Change-Id: I9dd3937e50ac3430c4982914de5b157222c8a5cd

commit_message:
Provide commands for example roles

In order to improve the experiance for the end user, we have existing
sets of roles that can be combined in a roles_data.yaml file for the
deployment. This change exposes the ability to generate roles_data.yaml
from a folder containing role yaml files rather than requiring the end
user manually construct the roles_data.yaml.

Change-Id: I326bae5bdee088e03aa89128d253612ef89e5c0c
Related-Blueprint: example-custom-role-environments

commit_message:
contrail: add vrouter VIF plugin type support

The VIF plugin will provide support OpenContrail SDN Controller driver
in nova. It will initially be used for OpenContrail dpdk driver.
The plugin is located here:
https://github.com/Juniper/contrail-nova-vif-driver

Implements: blueprint opencontrail-nova-vif-plugin
Change-Id: Ic23effc05c901575f608f2b4c5ccd2b1fb3c2d5a

commit_message:
fix path for ldlinux.c32

This fixes the path for ldlinux.c32. It should be in the absolute
path /usr/..., not the relative path usr/...

Related-Bug: #1694394

This is a followup to ead3b90655979d0423f409b21a17da9e28a8de1b

Change-Id: I0aaae7e337b1ac631f789c11b3bf6e944e395456

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-07 11:00:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Fix cell0 naming when QS params on the connection

We had a problem when the nova connection string included parameters on the
query string like charset encoding.
Note that the connection string necessarly needs to be RFC1738 compliant as
per Sqlalchemy rules, so it's totally safe to just unquote what the SQLA
helper method gives us as a result.

Also removed a tested connection string since it wasn't RFC1738 compatible.

Change-Id: I45fe9b92e8d93a0099d33bb0070e9d4e540595ac
Closes-Bug: #1696001
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cell0 naming when QS params on the connection

We had a problem when the nova connection string included parameters on the
query string like charset encoding.
Note that the connection string necessarly needs to be RFC1738 compliant as
per Sqlalchemy rules, so it's totally safe to just unquote what the SQLA
helper method gives us as a result.

Also removed a tested connection string since it wasn't RFC1738 compatible.

Change-Id: I45fe9b92e8d93a0099d33bb0070e9d4e540595ac
Closes-Bug: #1696001

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I5f529e5f15341e28b257cd42766e66390469d3f6
Closes-Bug:#1693670

commit_message:
controller: Upd. remaining refs to generic vif

In 97ded78681060b6ca36c9d12ee81a8ba13c69ff9 we renamed
GenericPodVIFDriver to the more accurate NeutronPodVIFDriver.
Unfortunately we missed a few places. This patch solves that.

Change-Id: I441e7236f9e2bb1f64ad5ae5bcc43218adf5abb3
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: I532fe2537fcd2ae6b4344d214a308b1a26416745

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-05-23 12:45:48.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/tests/test_impl_ifcfg.py', 'os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py', 'etc/os-net-config/samples/ovs_dpdk.json', 'etc/os-net-config/samples/ovs_dpdk.yaml', 'os_net_config/objects.py'], 'message': 'Configure multi-queue value for DPDK Port

The multi-queue option for DPDK is applied via ovs-vsctl command
via ovs_extra params. This patch adds support for configuring the
rx_queue (multi-queue) value to the DPDK Ports.

Change-Id: Ib9faad5e9d49f78e3a0b45ef3ae0082f3e9d14a6
Co-Authored-By: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>
implements: blueprint ovs-2-6-features-dpdk
'}]
commit_message:
Configure multi-queue value for DPDK Port

The multi-queue option for DPDK is applied via ovs-vsctl command
via ovs_extra params. This patch adds support for configuring the
rx_queue (multi-queue) value to the DPDK Ports.

Change-Id: Ib9faad5e9d49f78e3a0b45ef3ae0082f3e9d14a6
Co-Authored-By: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>
implements: blueprint ovs-2-6-features-dpdk

subject: Revert "upgrade astroid to 1.5.3"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-07 21:56:47.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Revert "upgrade astroid to 1.5.3"

This change breaks the trove gate. It is apparent from the line being changed that this change should also address the pylint version.

This close to the release gate, do we really need to be messing with these kinds of things and breaking project gates?

This reverts commit 99fae827973465147359cc7032c83003802612a7.

Change-Id: Ie340d5bb326f8aa6e066b36179c76ef7df24119a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "upgrade astroid to 1.5.3"

This change breaks the trove gate. It is apparent from the line being changed that this change should also address the pylint version.

This close to the release gate, do we really need to be messing with these kinds of things and breaking project gates?

This reverts commit 99fae827973465147359cc7032c83003802612a7.

Change-Id: Ie340d5bb326f8aa6e066b36179c76ef7df24119a

full description of the controller which should be used.

commit_message:
Remove translation of log messages

The i18n team has decided not to translate
the logs because it seems like it not very useful;
operators prefer to have them in English so that
they can search for those strings on the internet.

Closes-Bug: #1694193

Change-Id: I5b215eabd833c6e175168e7184944017815b0107

Replace oslo.messaging.get_transport with get_notification_transport

is deprecated: use get_rpc_transport or get_notification_transport

Change-Id: I797683cca360ec36feaaf4ee83aa72527605a2ed

commit_message:
Remove support for py34
The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka.
This is due to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial,
where only python3.5 is available.
There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I84552b20626af0474fa67d91124324e5bc9c775c

commit_message:
Filter services dictionary per host

To greatly reduce the amount of log noise from skipped tasks, set a
var in the role that filters the 'nova_services' dict to one that only
contains services relevant for each host.

Change-Id: I38ab4345f06ba6c9ef45cfe8e3ef48f2328b2333
(cherry picked from commit f2ed992208e4fdaa10a6c45a5797996d1ca20b51)

subject: Boot a VM in a subnet without gateway
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-25 09:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tempestplugin/smoke_test.sh', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_local_plugin.py', 'tricircle/network/helper.py', 'tricircle/network/local_plugin.py', 'tricircle/tempestplugin/smoke_test_validation.py'], 'message': "Boot a VM in a subnet without gateway

1. What is the problem
We can create a subnet without gateway in the central Neutron, but when
we boot a VM in that subnet, the request fails since local Neutron is
trying to calculate the IP allocation pool based on the central subnet
gateway IP, which is None.

2. What is the solution for the problem
If a central subnet doesn't have gateway, do not re-calculate local IP
allocation pool when creating local subnet.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Support booting a VM in a subnet that has not gateway

Change-Id: I04f7f9f9926f22bca3490ee46e2163b9c17bb8fe
Closes-Bug: #1693446
"}]
commit_message:
Boot a VM in a subnet without gateway

1. What is the problem
We can create a subnet without gateway in the central Neutron, but when
we boot a VM in that subnet, the request fails since local Neutron is
trying to calculate the IP allocation pool based on the central subnet
gateway IP, which is None.

2. What is the solution for the problem
If a central subnet doesn't have gateway, do not re-calculate local IP
allocation pool when creating local subnet.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Support booting a VM in a subnet that has not gateway

Change-Id: I04f7f9f9926f22bca3490ee46e2163b9c17bb8fe
Closes-Bug: #1693446

commit_message:
XenAPI: use os-xenapi 0.2.0 in nova

This patch is to change nova project to use os-xenapi 0.2.0 which
has added python interfaces for calling dom0 plugins
1. use os_xenapi.client.host_network
2. use os_xenapi.client.disk_management
3. use os_xenapi.client.vm_management
4. use os_xenapi.client.host_xenstore
5. use os_xenapi.client.host_agent
6. use os_xenapi.client.host_management
7. use os_xenapi.client.host_glance

Change-Id: Id87b83ef3ca496525f63b9c7b731e8a22c693e02

subject: Remove setting DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG in test_hook.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-31 08:33:03.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/gate_hook.sh'], 'message': 'Remove setting DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG in test_hook.sh

In the old version of the gates, we already set DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG
https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/47d2d8e9ec952a2f9d71fe7ab51e8bfd2c20ca64/jenkins/jobs/barbican.yaml#L21

In the new (experimental) version of the gates (see
I68810330dbee4033f8198f39aba5b75cd3357399), we use thew new recommended
local_conf instead of DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG (see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112872.html)

When we use local_conf in the new gates, DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG is not
needed and is not set. Thus, when test_hook.sh also sets
"enable_plugin barbican" in DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG, DevStack attempts to
use both DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG and local_conf, and a duplicate config
error is thrown during the stacking.

Co-Authored-By: Nam Nguyen Hoai <namnh@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Idd94b900b238c865a4074ec7d1f9c1c16ef8d434
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setting DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG in test_hook.sh

In the old version of the gates, we already set DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG
https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/47d2d8e9ec952a2f9d71fe7ab51e8bfd2c20ca64/jenkins/jobs/barbican.yaml#L21

In the new (experimental) version of the gates (see
I68810330dbee4033f8198f39aba5b75cd3357399), we use thew new recommended
local_conf instead of DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG (see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112872.html)

When we use local_conf in the new gates, DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG is not
needed and is not set. Thus, when test_hook.sh also sets
"enable_plugin barbican" in DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG, DevStack attempts to
use both DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG and local_conf, and a duplicate config
error is thrown during the stacking.

Co-Authored-By: Nam Nguyen Hoai <namnh@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Idd94b900b238c865a4074ec7d1f9c1c16ef8d434

subject: Perform an atomic policy file change
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-02 16:44:08.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_init_common.yml', 'tasks/cinder_post_install.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_init_systemd.yml'], 'message': 'Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Change-Id: Ia9df064ff145bec862e2a2cc0fd180a9188c5238
(cherry picked from commit fb807f2a607dfee37daf1fde90d52a71c66ac575)
'}]
commit_message:
Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Change-Id: Ia9df064ff145bec862e2a2cc0fd180a9188c5238
(cherry picked from commit fb807f2a607dfee37daf1fde90d52a71c66ac575)

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: If4db8872c4f5705c1fff017c4891626e9ce4d1e4

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-05-11 21:39:59.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/test_db_replicator.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py'], 'message': "Sync metadata in 'rsync_then_merge' in db_replicator

In previous 'rsync_then_merge' remote objects are merged with
rsync'ed local objects, but remote metadata is not merged with local
one. Account/Container replicator sometimes uses rsync for db sync if
there is a big difference of record history in db files between 'local'
and 'remote' servers. If replicator needs to rsync local db to remote
but metadata in local db is older, older info of metadata can be
distributed then some metadata values can be missing or go back to older.

This patch fixes this problem by merging 'remote' metadata with
rsync'ed local db file.

Closes-Bug: #1570118

Change-Id: Icdf0a936fc456c5462471938cbc365bd012b05d4
"}]
commit_message:
Sync metadata in 'rsync_then_merge' in db_replicator

In previous 'rsync_then_merge' remote objects are merged with
rsync'ed local objects, but remote metadata is not merged with local
one. Account/Container replicator sometimes uses rsync for db sync if
there is a big difference of record history in db files between 'local'
and 'remote' servers. If replicator needs to rsync local db to remote
but metadata in local db is older, older info of metadata can be
distributed then some metadata values can be missing or go back to older.

This patch fixes this problem by merging 'remote' metadata with
rsync'ed local db file.

Closes-Bug: #1570118

Change-Id: Icdf0a936fc456c5462471938cbc365bd012b05d4

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for instance actions endpoint

This patch adds instance actions related routes
by a plain list, instead of using stevedore. After all the Nova
API endpoints moves to the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore
for API loading will be removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: I1ae0797ac8ca1cd64bb0d92d4c14aa96d4a59d62

subject: Gather all operations for the reservations table into the manager
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-06-02 07:36:52.000000000', 'files': ['blazar/plugins/dummy_vm_plugin.py', 'blazar/plugins/oshosts/host_plugin.py', 'blazar/tests/plugins/test_physical_host_plugin.py', 'blazar/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/7f1a7bbb2cd2_add_aggregate_id_field_into_the_.py', 'blazar/manager/service.py', 'blazar/plugins/base.py', 'blazar/tests/manager/test_service.py', 'blazar/plugins/instances/vm_plugin.py', 'blazar/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Gather all operations for the reservations table into the manager

Records in the reservations table in the Blazar DB are created and
updated by both the manager and the resource plugin [1]. This results in
a lack of separation of concerns.

This patch migrates such operations from the resource plugin to the
manager. It makes the manager responsible for the reservations table,
and the resource plugin responsible only for resource specific tables
(e.g. the computehost_reservations table).

It also changes the resource_id field in the reservations table to hold
an ID of the record of resource-specific reservations tables, e.g.
computehost_reservations table for the physical-host plugin and
instance_reservations table for the new instance plugin [2].
An ID of resource itself which was held in the resource_id field is
migrated to the resource specific tables, so a new field 'aggregate_id'
is added into the computehost_rservations table.

The instance_reservations table of the new instance plugin is expected
to have resource IDs like a flavor ID, and aggregate ID, and instance
IDs. The ID of the record of the instance_reservations table is expected
to be held in the resource_id field of the reservations table.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/blazar-resource-plugin
[2] I03315216c3a6203e088e914ffb9fedf1e672d732

Change-Id: Ia042020088af9e34e3430c44814cd69f4ed303fb
"}]
commit_message:
Gather all operations for the reservations table into the manager

Records in the reservations table in the Blazar DB are created and
updated by both the manager and the resource plugin [1]. This results in
a lack of separation of concerns.

This patch migrates such operations from the resource plugin to the
manager. It makes the manager responsible for the reservations table,
and the resource plugin responsible only for resource specific tables
(e.g. the computehost_reservations table).

It also changes the resource_id field in the reservations table to hold
an ID of the record of resource-specific reservations tables, e.g.
computehost_reservations table for the physical-host plugin and
instance_reservations table for the new instance plugin [2].
An ID of resource itself which was held in the resource_id field is
migrated to the resource specific tables, so a new field 'aggregate_id'
is added into the computehost_rservations table.

The instance_reservations table of the new instance plugin is expected
to have resource IDs like a flavor ID, and aggregate ID, and instance
IDs. The ID of the record of the instance_reservations table is expected
to be held in the resource_id field of the reservations table.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/blazar-resource-plugin
[2] I03315216c3a6203e088e914ffb9fedf1e672d732

Change-Id: Ia042020088af9e34e3430c44814cd69f4ed303fb

commit_message:
Remove deprecated oslo_messaging.get_transport

DeprecationWarning:
Using function/method 'oslo_messaging.transport.get_transport()'
is deprecated: use get_rpc_transport or get_notification_transport.

Replace get_transport with get_notification_transport.

Change-Id: Ia32198e7e673154aeaa15757b1f733be61d8f58a

subject: update semver module for python 3.5
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-07 20:31:05.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/semver.py'], 'message': "update semver module for python 3.5

Python 3 does not allow comparison between integers and strings. The
semver RulesTest class includes a case where the most recent tag is an
EOL name tag, and the comparison breaks under Python 3. This patch
modifies the comparison to skip over tags that can't be compared to only
look at numerical versions.

Depends-On: I9e56e1e5b0171f8ed4ae05c6aba36c4c733486fa
Change-Id: Id9ad068a279653ffb20c60d1752e41bb0e7bc5d1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
update semver module for python 3.5

Python 3 does not allow comparison between integers and strings. The
semver RulesTest class includes a case where the most recent tag is an
EOL name tag, and the comparison breaks under Python 3. This patch
modifies the comparison to skip over tags that can't be compared to only
look at numerical versions.

Depends-On: I9e56e1e5b0171f8ed4ae05c6aba36c4c733486fa
Change-Id: Id9ad068a279653ffb20c60d1752e41bb0e7bc5d1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Ensure that role tests pin pip/setuptools/wheel

Currently the role tests use whatever versions of pip,
setuptools and wheel are already installed on the host.

When a version of these tools changes it often causes
problems for our testing.

This will ensure that we use a known good set of pins
which is maintained in the general SHA bumping process.

Change-Id: I5720eb69cfbbe24136ebdfcac9c68893b3595b27
(cherry picked from commit 0ca9a2c45ca9b38229b6efa7d553cc405e098246)

commit_message:
Ensure that role tests pin pip/setuptools/wheel

Currently the role tests use whatever versions of pip,
setuptools and wheel are already installed on the host.

When a version of these tools changes it often causes
problems for our testing.

This will ensure that we use a known good set of pins
which is maintained in the general SHA bumping process.

Change-Id: I5720eb69cfbbe24136ebdfcac9c68893b3595b27
(cherry picked from commit 0ca9a2c45ca9b38229b6efa7d553cc405e098246)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2711, 'name': 'Zhang Hua', 'display_name': 'Zhang Hua', 'email': 'joshua.zhang@canonical.com', 'username': 'zhhuabj'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 15888, 'name': 'Zhenyu Zheng', 'email': 'zheng.zhenyu@outlook.com', 'username': 'Kevin_Zheng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-09 18:21:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/cells_api.py'], 'message': "Get BDMs when we need to in _handle_cell_delete

The BDM list was originally added in this flow
in change Id68330eb238a304eaceefa7c0ec2fa0d2b60d28a
and it's only used for the _local_delete call but
over time with the cells v2 code it's been moved
away. This change moves the BDM query back to
right before _local_delete so we don't make an
unnecessary call in a semi-time sensitive code
path (because of the race between deleting the
instance in the API and the conductor deleting
the build request).

Change-Id: I6f4055adbc33701a39cf2b92eff101083a4f56f6
"}]
commit_message:
Get BDMs when we need to in _handle_cell_delete

The BDM list was originally added in this flow
in change Id68330eb238a304eaceefa7c0ec2fa0d2b60d28a
and it's only used for the _local_delete call but
over time with the cells v2 code it's been moved
away. This change moves the BDM query back to
right before _local_delete so we don't make an
unnecessary call in a semi-time sensitive code
path (because of the race between deleting the
instance in the API and the conductor deleting
the build request).

Change-Id: I6f4055adbc33701a39cf2b92eff101083a4f56f6

'}]
commit_message:
Add sudo to docker log command

There are two spots where docker log is run without sudo, and
without sudo the command will usually fail and the loop will
never be exited. This would only be hit on an error.

Change-Id: I4335783478ad2583b581bd9264b029e929bfc8c3

commit_message:
Ensure that role tests pin pip/setuptools/wheel

Currently the role tests use whatever versions of pip,
setuptools and wheel are already installed on the host.

When a version of these tools changes it often causes
problems for our testing.

This will ensure that we use a known good set of pins
which is maintained in the general SHA bumping process.

Change-Id: I82d501f836750fadd943c7d9c488b949907a1f11

commit_message:
Filter services dictionary per host

To greatly reduce the amount of log noise from skipped tasks, set a
var in the role that filters the 'nova_services' dict to one that only
contains services relevant for each host.

Conflicts:
>------handlers/main.yml
>------tasks/cinder_init_systemd.yml

Change-Id: I38ab4345f06ba6c9ef45cfe8e3ef48f2328b2333
(cherry picked from commit f2ed992208e4fdaa10a6c45a5797996d1ca20b51)

subject: Perform an atomic policy file change
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-02 17:54:46.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_init_common.yml', 'tasks/cinder_post_install.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_init_systemd.yml'], 'message': 'Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Conflicts:
>------handlers/main.yml
>------tasks/cinder_init_common.yml
>------tasks/cinder_init_upstart.yml

Change-Id: Ia9df064ff145bec862e2a2cc0fd180a9188c5238
(cherry picked from commit fb807f2a607dfee37daf1fde90d52a71c66ac575)
'}]
commit_message:
Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Conflicts:
>------handlers/main.yml
>------tasks/cinder_init_common.yml
>------tasks/cinder_init_upstart.yml

Change-Id: Ia9df064ff145bec862e2a2cc0fd180a9188c5238
(cherry picked from commit fb807f2a607dfee37daf1fde90d52a71c66ac575)

commit_message:
Expose neutron api application as a wsgi script

This can then be loaded into a wsgi compatible web server like
apache2/httpd or nginx.

DocImpact A new neutron-api script is installed, and can be used to
start either a standalone wsgi server (calling the script directly),
or as a wsgi script loaded by a web server (e.g. by httpd/mod_wsgi).

Change-Id: Ie9bb8b33f6e1335219e574d832ac264b043d90e6
Partial-Bug: #1666779
Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 429703a9a8781c38c709551a3cfed35ca3d2c574)

document the application parameters and the support for multiple output
formats recently added.

commit_message:
Ensure that role tests pin pip/setuptools/wheel

Currently the role tests use whatever versions of pip,
setuptools and wheel are already installed on the host.

When a version of these tools changes it often causes
problems for our testing.

This will ensure that we use a known good set of pins
which is maintained in the general SHA bumping process.

Change-Id: I51c2dc4470700650f0c47cbfc2c7cd662353038d
